issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
I am conducting research on log related bugs. I tried to make a tool to fix repetitive yet simple patterns of bugs that are related to logs. Typos in log messages are one of the reoccurring bugs. Therefore, I made a tool find typos in log statements. During my experiments, I managed to find the following typos in Hadoop MapReduce:

In file /hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-app/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapred/TaskAttemptListenerImpl.java, LOG.info("Done acknowledgement from " + taskAttemptID.toString()), 
acknowledgement should be acknowledgment

In file /hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-app/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapreduce/jobhistory/JobHistoryEventHandler.java, LOG.info("Exception while cancelling delayed flush timer. "+ "Likely caused by a failed flush " + e.getMessage()), 
cancelling should be canceling

In file /hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapred/Task.java, LOG.info("Runnning cleanup for the task"), 
Runnning should be Running

In file /hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-shuffle/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapred/ShuffleHandler.java, LOG.info("Storing state DB schedma version info " + getCurrentVersion()), 
schedma should be schema

comments.body:
[~MehranHassani],
Thanks for raising these issues, thought not critical but definitely makes sense in fixing them.
Wondering whether this tool of yours can be integrated in the jenkins build process, so wanted to know whether your tool works on the code or the log file ?

Our tool is a static code analysis tool so it works on source code and it can be built into Jenkins. We also detect other bug patterns in logs, such as wrong log level, missing logs in exception handling block and others. We will report those bugs as well if you are interested we can provide more detailed information.
is the static analysis tool available for us to use directly? what license is it under?
We will release it as open source soon.

Have added your name to the contributor list and assigned the jira to you [~MehranHassani],
acknowledgement => acknowledgment  & cancelling =>canceling  seems to be not completely necessary, but any anyway patch seems to be fine and will commit it shortly

MAPREDUCE-6777. Typos in 4 log messages. Contributed by Mehran Hassani (naganarasimha_gr: rev 7d21c280a82b2f02675bf0048f0e965d99a05ae7)
